message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "This analysis is based on data from the World Health Organization's Global Health Observatory and the United Nations Statistics Division.", "dataset": ["World Health Organization's Global Health Observatory", "United Nations Statistics Division"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "We used data from the National Longitudinal Study of Adolescent Health to examine the relationship between family structure and adolescent health outcomes.", "dataset": ["National Longitudinal Study of Adolescent Health"], "topic": ["Health", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "This report combines survey data from the World Bank Enterprise Surveys and financial statement data from Orbis.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Surveys", "Orbis"], "topic": ["Financial Sector", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "To understand the drivers of deforestation in Brazil, we combined spatially explicit data from the Brazilian Agricultural Research Corporation (EMBRAPA) and field-based surveys.", "dataset": ["Brazilian Agricultural Research Corporation (EMBRAPA)"], "topic": ["Environment"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the International Labor Organization's Labor Force Survey, we analyzed trends in informal employment across several countries in Southeast Asia.", "dataset": ["International Labor Organization's Labor Force Survey"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "We complemented household survey data from the Living Standards Measurement Study and demographic data from the United Nations Population Division with climate data from the Climatic Research Unit at the University of East Anglia.", "dataset": ["Living Standards Measurement Study", "United Nations Population Division", "Climatic Research Unit at the University of East Anglia"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "This study uses data from the World Values Survey and the European Social Survey to investigate the relationship between income inequality and social trust.", "dataset": ["World Values Survey", "European Social Survey"], "topic": ["Inequality and Shared Prosperity", "Social Sustainability and Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "We used data from the National Longitudinal Survey of Youth to examine the effect of early childhood education on later life outcomes.", "dataset": ["National Longitudinal Survey of Youth"], "topic": ["Education"]}, {"sentence": "This analysis uses a combination of satellite imagery from the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration's VIIRS instrument and census data from the Government of India to study the impact of electrification on light pollution in rural areas.", "dataset": ["National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration's VIIRS instrument", "Government of India census data"], "topic": ["Energy", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "To understand the drivers of economic growth in Africa, we combined data on infrastructure stocks from the World Bank's Infrastructure Capital Stock Database with data on public expenditure from the International Monetary Fund's Government Finance Statistics database.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Infrastructure Capital Stock Database", "International Monetary Fund's Government Finance Statistics database"], "topic": ["Infrastructure", "Macroeconomics"]}]
